hedline.hl1: A Very Big Picnic For Bastille Day

abstract.p: Bastille Day 2000 events in France will include giant public picnic along 597-mile stretch of Paris Meridian, running from Dunkirk to Prats-de-Molo on Spanish border, air show and multidisciplinary relay race; three million people are expected to participate (S)

block.p: On July 14, tanks will roll down the Champs-Elysees and fighter planes will swoop overhead for the traditional military parade that marks the birthday of the French Republic. Across the nation, there will be fireworks and open-air dances.

But Bastille Day 2000 calls for something special. Last November, schoolchildren started planting thousands of saplings along the Paris Meridian, the line running 2 degrees 20 minutes 14 seconds east of Greenwich, from Dunkirk to Prats-de-Molo on the Spanish border. On Bastille Day, this 597-mile tree line sets the stage for the largest dejeuner sur l'herbe in French history.

On July 14, tanks will roll down the Champs-Elysees and fighter planes will swoop overhead for the traditional military parade that marks the birthday of the French Republic. Across the nation, there will be fireworks and open-air dances.

But Bastille Day 2000 calls for something special. Last November, schoolchildren started planting thousands of saplings along the Paris Meridian, the line running 2 degrees 20 minutes 14 seconds east of Greenwich, from Dunkirk to Prats-de-Molo on the Spanish border. On Bastille Day, this 597-mile tree line sets the stage for the largest dejeuner sur l'herbe in French history.

Roughly 405 miles of checkered tablecloth will be spread over picnic tables -- some of them up to six-tenths of a mile long -- along the Meridian. Three million people are expected to bring picnic baskets or stock up on regional delicacies at adjoining market stalls. An air show and a multidisciplinary relay race -- on everything from bicycles to roller skates to horses -- following the picnic path will round out the festivities.

On or off the meridian, each town is adding its own flourish to the nationwide party. Amiens puts an Aussie accent on the holiday with a brass band from Canberra, boomerang lessons and a giant Australian barbecue. Avignon will see off the Provencal lap of the Tour de France bicycle race. And in Paris, over seven miles of tables will be set up from the Porte de Montmartre to the Porte de Gentilly -- a track that slices though the Avenue de l'Opera, the Louvre courtyard and the Jardin du Luxembourg.
News on the festivities is available at www.wmevent.net (in French only) or www.2000enfrance.com.
